lines.text: He changed again and you bought it on I never be able to thank you enough, Never!

Don't worry, I'm not going to make any excuses. It was a dirty business, rotten right from the very beginning to the end. I'm not going to tell you I didn't know what I was doing but, for what it's worth, you were never a part of it. You've got to believe that. The rest of it was a masquerade but where you were concerned, it was real.
Stop it, Dennis. Stop it.
It's the truth, I swear it. If it weren't, I wouldn't be here.
Quite desperate for money, aren't you? Take any chance to get it.
Any.
By a new twist of fortune, so would I. And I know the way to entice Lady Luck to smile on both of us.
Out of which side of our mouth?
What do the gold teeth show?
Money should only be left in the hands of those who know who to spend it.
Oh, listen to them. How can you stand it?

[laughs]
You get use to the dingos.
I don't just mean the dingos. This loneliness, this isolation. This big, awful emptiness.
I've never felt lonely here.
Never?
Well, you can feel lonely anywhere. It isn't the place that makes you lonely.
I don't belong here. Never will.
Do you know where you belong?
Where there's life. Any street in London. Any boulevard in Paris.
How do I know you won't lead me into a trap?
You don't.

[looking over the countryside]
Look. Far as I can see. All mine. The work of me luck.
